meanings.definition: A person who entertains by juggling objects.
meanings.sent1: The jugglers at the circus amazed the audience with their skills.
meanings.sent2: We hired jugglers for the birthday party to entertain the kids.
meanings.sent3: The jugglers at the talent show made everyone laugh with their funny faces.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to multitask at work makes her a juggler of responsibilities.
meanings.sent5: The street performer stood out among the crowd of jugglers with his unique style.

meanings.definition: A group of people who juggle objects for entertainment.
meanings.sent1: The jugglers in the park attracted a large crowd with their colorful props.
meanings.sent2: The circus had a team of talented jugglers who performed breathtaking routines.
meanings.sent3: The jugglers in the talent competition practiced together every day to perfect their act.
meanings.sent4: The political campaign was like a group of jugglers trying to balance different agendas.
meanings.sent5: The festival featured a variety of jugglers from around the world showcasing their skills.
